intro: Friesodielsia auriculata, commonly known as the auriculate balm, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for both ecological and horticultural purposes.
